##  Statistic Analysis 


In the following section we will show the results for each fungicide


```{r function to take outliers from 6 observations}
# First function to move away outliers
get_range <- function(mynumber) {
  bb <- boxplot.stats(mynumber)
  cc <- bb$stats
  dd <- max(cc)
  ee <- min(cc)
  return(data.frame(upper = dd, lower = ee))
}

# Second function to get EC50

getting_EC50 <- function(filename){
  
  getting.EC50 <- EC_table(filename, form = response ~ dose)
getting.EC50 <- getting.EC50 %>% 
  rename(ID = sample ) %>% # renaming
  rename(EC50 = Estimate.50) %>%
  mutate(ID = as.factor(ID))
}

```


```{r read data}
#Reading function
reading_data <- function(filename){
  data <-
  read.csv(filename)
 # data <- subset(data, select = -X)
  data$repeats <- rep_len(1:3, length.out = nrow(data))
  
  data <- data %>%
         mutate(polar= replace(growth, growth == 0, 6)) %>%  #replacing 0 cm growth for the size of plug that is 0.6
     group_by(ID, experimental_replicate, concentration, growth, repeats) %>%
  rename(dose = concentration )
  }
###  Reading and subsetting data


lasiodiplodia.spp.chlorothalonil <-
  reading_data("../data/DATOS SENSIBILIDAD Lasiodiplodia spp_ chlorothalonil.csv")




 
```
# chlorothalonil
##  Serial Dilution
```{r Serial dilution Colletotrichum chlorothalonil,  warning=FALSE}
# Colletotrichum chlorothalonil fungicide taking the outliers from the 6 observations of each one USING THE FUCTION
chlorothalonil.filtered  <- lasiodiplodia.spp.chlorothalonil %>%
  group_by(ID, dose) %>%
  mutate(growth_range = list(get_range(growth))) %>%
  unnest() %>%
  filter(growth <= upper & growth >= lower) %>%
  rename(response = growth) %>%
  ungroup() %>%
  select(c(ID, experimental_replicate, repeats, dose, response))

#Using the function to get eEC50 and summarizing
lasiodiplodia.spp.EC50_chlorothalonil <- getting_EC50(chlorothalonil.filtered) 

summary.lasiodiplodia.spp.EC50_chlorothalonil <-summary(lasiodiplodia.spp.EC50_chlorothalonil)

write.csv(lasiodiplodia.spp.EC50_chlorothalonil, file = "../outputs/lasiodiplodia.spp.EC50_chlorothalonil.csv")
write.csv(summary.lasiodiplodia.spp.EC50_chlorothalonil, file = "../outputs/summary.lasiodiplodia.spp.EC50_chlorothalonil.csv")
```
